The Louisiana Mineral and Energy Board collected nearly $ 581,000 for the May sale of oil and gas lease rights on state and local lands , a sharp decrease from April .

The drop in revenue was due in part to the board 's decision to reject several bids from companies seeking rights to drill areas at the heart of the emerging Tuscaloosa Marine Shale oil and gas formation .

The drop in revenue was due in part to the board 's decision to reject several bids from companies seeking rights to drill areas at the heart of the emerging Tuscaloosa Marine Shale oil and gas formation .
Activity in the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale has been the center of controversy as one company seeks to drill a new well targeting the formation in St. Tammany Parish .

The Tuscaloosa Marine Shale spans much of central Louisiana and the Florida Parishes , though drilling activity has largely clustered East Feliciana , West Feliciana and St. Helena parishes along the Louisiana - Mississippi border .

RelatedSentence: The board did not accept the bids -- which included eight from Frisco , Texas - based Comstock Oil & Gas Louisiana LLC -- because they were too low , according to state records .
The state awarded 12 leases total covering 1,817 acres out of 47 nominated tracts covering more than 30,840 acres .
Seven companies participated in the May sale .
led bidding activity , offering more than $ 371,000 for five tracts in Terrebonne Parish , including more than $ 64,000 for 304 acres in state waters .
The board also sold leases in Acadia , Allen , Cameron , Plaquemines , St. Helena and St. Martin parishes .
Comstock Oil & Gas submitted nine bids totaling $ 80,495 for areas in St. Helena and East Feliciana parishes .
Houston - based HK TMS had both of its bids rejected .
The company bid $ 14,715 total for two leases in East Feliciana Parish .
The Louisiana Mineral and Energy Board has collected $ 17.1 million so far this fiscal year , which began July 1 , 2013 .
The state collected $ 18.3 million total during the previous fiscal year .
